name: cycrimine
content: Cycrimine (trade name Pagitane) is a central anticholinergic drug designed to reduce the levels of acetylcholine in the treatment of Parkinson's disease. Its mechanism of action is to bind to the muscarinic acetylcholine receptor M1.   == Synthesis ==   == See also == Biperiden Procyclidine Trihexyphenidyl   == References ==   == External links == Cycrimine at DrugLib.com
